qas.question: What is the main component of drying the paper?
At what percentage moisture content is the papermaking process trying to achieve in the end?
What involves using air and heat to add water to the paper sheets?
When was drying done by laying the sheets on the floor?
Which is the least common on the paper machine?
What is used in short sequences of less than 40 cans?
What is able to dry the paper to less than 200% moisture?
What is not the main component of drying the paper?
At what percentage moisture content is the papermaking process not trying to achieve in the end?

context: <b2_0>Drying<b2_0/> involves using <a0_0><b7_0>air<b7_0/><a0_0/> and/or heat to remove water from the paper sheets; in the <b3_0>earliest days of paper making<b3_0/> this was done by hanging the sheets like laundry; in more modern times various forms of heated drying mechanisms are used. On the paper machine the most common is the <b4_0><b5_0>steam heated can dryer<b4_0/>.<b5_0/> These can reach temperatures above 200 °F (93 °C) and are used in long sequences of more than 40 cans; where the <b6_0>heat<b6_0/> produced by these can easily dry the paper to less than <a1_0><b8_0>6<b8_0/><a1_0/>% moisture.
